jx.jx_en_mean: without any fuss or delay; immediately

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English  (originally in the sense 'action, business'): from northern Middle English  at do 'to do', from Old Norse at (used to mark an infinitive) and do

entry.def: If you do something without further ado or without more ado, you do it at once and do not discuss or delay it any longer.

example.ex: 'And now, without further ado, let me introduce our benefactor.'
example.tran: “下面，闲话少说，让我来介绍一下我们的赞助人。”
